children: The anatomy of the eye, comparing normal with closed-angle glaucoma. Particular attention should be paid to size of the angle in eye with normal anatomy (where it is larger) and the size of angle in patient with narrow angle due to the positioning of the iris.

footnotes: Reproduced with permission from Walker HK, Hall WD, Hurst JW, Editors. Clinical Methods: The History, Physical, and Laboratory Examinations, third edition. Chapter 118, Tonometry. Boston: Butterworth Heinemann, 1990.
